title: Shirt
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Shirt/zh-CN "Shirt/zh-CN")

A **shirt** is a type of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* and is generally worn underneath body armor.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 List of shirts](#List_of_shirts)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Generation

Shirts make up 1% of all randomly generated armor.

## List of shirts

There are two types of shirt in *NetHack*:

| Name                                                    | Cost | Weight | [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") | Weight/AC | Material | [MC](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") | Appearance |
| ------------------------------------------------------- | ---- | ------ | ------------------------------------- | --------- | -------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ---------- |
| [T-shirt](/wiki/T-shirt "T-shirt")                      | 2    | 5      | 0                                     | 0         | cloth    | 0                                                   | —          |
| [Hawaiian shirt](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt") | 3    | 5      | 0                                     | 0         | cloth    | 0                                                   | —          |

## Strategy

Shirts confer no base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") on their own, but can be [enchanted](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") into a lightweight source of extra AC - they are most valuable for this purpose once a character has obtained [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging") to protect them from [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap"), since polymorphing into a large form will destroy torso armor. In the early game, it may be better to enchant other armor such as a [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm"), [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") or [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"); in the later stages, they are a somewhat common form of [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") used to complete late-game and [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") by topping off a character's AC.

Shirts are a popular target for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") since they are non-magical, making them fairly easy to obtain by [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") a large pile of armor - the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle") and [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") in particular always guarantee a sufficient amount of armor, and the Castle's armor storeroom has a significant 13.13% chance of containing a shirt. The random general store items in [Orcus Town](/wiki/Orcus_Town "Orcus Town") may also have a shirt among them.

The table below contains a breakdown of the probabilities of success for polypiling a shirt:

| Confidence               | 25%   | 50%   | 75%    | 95%    |
| ------------------------ | ----- | ----- | ------ | ------ |
| Polymorphs               | 28.62 | 68.97 | 137.94 | 298.07 |
| Armors needed (blessed)  | 3.59  | 8.66  | 17.32  | 37.41  |
| Armors needed (uncursed) | 5.51  | 13.29 | 26.58  | 57.42  |

## Variants

[Variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant") of *NetHack* often add new types of shirts - those that incorporate the [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") role add the [striped shirt](/wiki/Striped_shirt "Striped shirt"), which all Convicts start the game with.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several shirts with distinct effects:

- [Ruffled shirts](/wiki/Ruffled_shirt "Ruffled shirt"), which grant a +1 bonus to [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma")
- [Victorian underwear](/wiki/Victorian_underwear "Victorian underwear"), which grant a charisma bonus of +2 and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")3, at the cost of a -2 penalty to AC and reduction of [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") bonuses
- [Bodygloves](/wiki/Anachrononaut#Bodyglove "Anachrononaut"), which are [future tech](/wiki/Anachrononaut#Future_tech "Anachrononaut") available to [Anachrononauts](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut")
- [Black dresses](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack_Items#Underclothes "User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack Items"), which are worn primarily by female [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble")
- [Plain dresses](/wiki/Plain_dress "Plain dress"), which can be found on certain monsters such as [witches](/wiki/Witch_\(dNetHack\) "Witch (dNetHack)")
- [Ichcahuipilli](/index.php?title=Ichcahuipilli\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ichcahuipilli (page does not exist)")
- Striped shirts, which Convicts start the game with

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds a few shirt-type items:

- [Dresses](/index.php?title=Dress\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dress (page does not exist)")
- [Gowns](/index.php?title=Gown\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gown (page does not exist)")
- [Tuxedos](/index.php?title=Tuxedo\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tuxedo (page does not exist)")
- Striped shirts

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the following shirts:

- Ruffled shirts from dNetHack, which behave as ordinary shirts
- Victorian underwear from dNetHack, which still grants MC3 at the cost of an AC penalty
- [Expensive suits](/wiki/Expensive_suit "Expensive suit") from the [NetHack--](/wiki/NetHack-- "NetHack--") series, which [Undertakers](/wiki/Undertaker "Undertaker") start with
- Striped shirts, which Convicts start the game with

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Shirt

From NetHackWiki

English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎

A shirt is a type of armor that appears in NetHack and is generally worn underneath body armor.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 List of shirts
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 dNetHack
    • 4.2 SpliceHack
    • 4.3 SlashTHEM

Generation

Shirts make up 1% of all randomly generated armor.

List of shirts

There are two types of shirt in NetHack:

Name Cost Weight AC Weight/AC Material MC Appearance
T-shirt 2 5 0 0 cloth 0 —
Hawaiian shirt 3 5 0 0 cloth 0 —

Strategy

Shirts confer no base AC on their own, but can be enchanted into a lightweight source of extra AC - they are most valuable for this purpose once a character has obtained magic resistance or unchanging to protect them from polymorph traps, since polymorphing into a large form will destroy torso armor. In the early game, it may be better to enchant other armor such as a helm, boots or gloves; in the later stages, they are a somewhat common form of wish used to complete late-game and ascension kits by topping off a character's AC.

Shirts are a popular target for polypiling since they are non-magical, making them fairly easy to obtain by polymorphing a large pile of armor - the Castle and Fort Ludios in particular always guarantee a sufficient amount of armor, and the Castle's armor storeroom has a significant 13.13% chance of containing a shirt. The random general store items in Orcus Town may also have a shirt among them.

The table below contains a breakdown of the probabilities of success for polypiling a shirt:

Confidence 25% 50% 75% 95%
Polymorphs 28.62 68.97 137.94 298.07
Armors needed (blessed) 3.59 8.66 17.32 37.41
Armors needed (uncursed) 5.51 13.29 26.58 57.42

Variants

Variants of NetHack often add new types of shirts - those that incorporate the Convict role add the striped shirt, which all Convicts start the game with.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several shirts with distinct effects:

  • Ruffled shirts, which grant a +1 bonus to charisma
  • Victorian underwear, which grant a charisma bonus of +2 and MC3, at the cost of a -2 penalty to AC and reduction of dexterity bonuses
  • Bodygloves, which are future tech available to Anachrononauts
  • Black dresses, which are worn primarily by female drow Nobles
  • Plain dresses, which can be found on certain monsters such as witches
  • Ichcahuipilli
  • Striped shirts, which Convicts start the game with

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds a few shirt-type items:

  • Dresses
  • Gowns
  • Tuxedos
  • Striped shirts

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM adds the following shirts:

  • Ruffled shirts from dNetHack, which behave as ordinary shirts
  • Victorian underwear from dNetHack, which still grants MC3 at the cost of an AC penalty
  • Expensive suits from the NetHack-- series, which Undertakers start with
  • Striped shirts, which Convicts start the game with
